charges.charge_description: ATTEMPT AND CONSPIRACY TO COMMIT MAIL FRAUD; Conspiracy to commit wire fraud(1)

charges.charge_disposition: Defendant is imprisoned for a total to 205 months on counts 1 through 10, to run concurrent with each other; 3 years Supervised Release on counts 1 through 10, to run concurrent with each other; $100.00 Special Assessment on each count for a total amount of $1,000.00. Restitution in the amount of $4,513,075.00 jointly and severally with co-defendant Alex Hurt and Mariame Robinson-Cowan in Case No. 3:14CR219 (JBA), payable immediately, at a rate of not less than $500.00 per month.

charges.charge_description: FRAUD BY WIRE, RADIO, OR TELEVISION; Wire Fraud(2-10)

charges.charge_disposition: Defendant is imprisoned for a total to 205 months on counts 1 through 10, to run concurrent with each other; 3 years Supervised Release on counts 1 through 10, to run concurrent with each other; $100.00 Special Assessment on each count for a total amount of $1,000.00. Restitution in the amount of $4,513,075.00 jointly and severally with co-defendant Alex Hurt and Mariame Robinson-Cowan in Case No. 3:14CR219 (JBA), payable immediately, at a rate of not less than $500.00 per month.

charges.charge_description: ATTEMPT AND CONSPIRACY TO COMMIT MAIL FRAUD; Conspiracy to commit wire fraud(1)

charges.charge_disposition: The defendant is hereby committed to the custody of the Federal Bureau of Prisons to be imprisoned for a total of 60 months on each count 1, 7, 8, 9, &; 11 to run concurrently with each other. 3 years Supervised Release on each count 1, 7, 8, 9, &; 11 to run concurrently with each other. Defendant shall pay restitution in the amount of $2,255,000.00 jointly and severally with co-defendant David C. Jackson, payable at a rate of not less than $300.00 per month. Payment will commence on the first month after he begins his supervised release. The monthly payment schedule may be adjusted based on the defendants ability to pay as determined by the Probation Office and approved by the Court. Defendant shall participate in a mental health treatment program recommended by the Probation Office. The defendant shall pay all or a portion of costs associated with treatment based on the defendants ability to pay as recommended by the probation officer and approved by the Court. The defendant shall not incur new credit card charges above $300.00 or open additional lines of credit without the prior permission of the Probation Office until the defendants criminal debt obligation is paid. The defendant shall not add any new names to any lines of credit, shall not be added as a secondary card holder on anothers line of credit, and shall provide the Probation Office with electronic access to any online management of any lines of credit, including lines of credit for businesses/LLCs that are owned, operated or otherwise associated with the defendant. The defendant shall close all other savings/check accounts, consolidate all assets into one main bank account and shall not add any new account holders to that account (the account may include the defendants spouse if there are joint marital assets/expenses). The defendant shall provide the final statement from each account that is closed to ensure that no funds are dissipated during the closing of existing accounts and opening of the single account. $500.00 Special Assessment. Restitution in the amount of $2,255,000.00 jointly and severally with co-defendant David C. Jackson.
